# Hilbert spaces of Metrics

The space $\mathbb{M}^{n\times n}$ becomes a Hilbert space with inner product
$$
\left< \bm{A},\bm{B} \right>=\mathop{\text{tr}}\left( \bm{A^{*}B} \right)
$$
which is called **Hilbert-Schmidt** inner product. The matrix units $\bm{E(ij)}$, where $\bm{E(ij)_{mn}}=1$ when $m=i,n=j$ and $0$ otherwise, form an orthogonal basis.


::: {.theorem  name=""}

Let $\phi:\mathcal{H}\to \mathbb{K}$ be a functional on finite dimension $\mathcal{H}$, then there is a unique vector $v \in \mathcal{H}$ $s.t.$
$$
\phi(x)=\left< v,x \right>
$$

:::


:::: {.proof}

Take orthonormal basis $\left\{ e_i \right\}_{i=1}^{n}$ in $\mathcal{H}$, then
$$
v=\sum_{i=1}^{n} \overline{\phi(e_i)}e_i
$$
satisfy the condition


::::
